author: Alexandra Klausner
title: My man boobs are costing me a shot at MMA glory
text:
A teen mixed martial arts fighter says there’s only one thing getting in the way of his career — his man boobs.
Jeremiah Mastrogiacomo, 19, from Cape Coral, Florida, has suffered with male breast enlargement — called gynecomastia — since he was 13 years old.
“The doctors think that at puberty there was an imbalance of hormones and my body produced more estrogen than testosterone,” Mastrogiacomo told Caters of his embarrassing condition.
The 5-foot-11, formerly overweight teen, who lost nearly 80 pounds by cutting out carbs and learning MMA, is still plagued by swaying breast tissue that he claims gets in the way of his craft.
Mastrogiacomo, who at one point consumed 5,000 calories a day, lost weight so that he could be an eligible candidate for vaser liposuction surgery to have the breasts removed.
It was in the process of getting fit that Mastrogiacomo became passionate about MMA fighting. Despite building a muscular physique, Mastrogiacomo is still haunted by his childhood insecurities.
“I used to tell myself I wasn’t good enough. I’ve never had serious relationships. I never thought someone would want me long-term, as a teen it was tough. There were limitations like not going to the beach or taking my shirt off,” Mastrogiacomo told Caters.
Mastrogiacomo, who trains five days per week, says he looks great with a T-shirt on, yet he still fears exposing his chest.
“I can feel them swaying around. It feels like an alien on my body,” Mastrogiacomo said of his man breasts.
“I do still feel insecure even when people tell me I look great. I’ve grown a body dysmorphia in a way,” said Mastrogiacomo, adding that surgery would be the final part of his physical transformation.
Mastrogiacomo started a GoFundMe page with a goal of $9,000 to help him raise enough money for surgery before his first amateur MMA fight in July.
